sources.title: Body and Soul
sources.description: Title: Body and Soul Summary: A talented boxer's young career hits difficult terrain when an unethical promoter takes interest in him. Directed by: Robert Rossen Actors: John Garfield, Lilli Palmer, Hazel Brooks Production Company: Enterprise Productions Release Date: 9 November 1947 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Charley Davis wins an amateur boxing match and is taken on by promoter Quinn. Charley's mother doesn't want him to fight, but when Charley's father is accidentally killed, Charley sets up a fight for money. His career blooms as he wins fight after fight, but soon an unethical promoter named Roberts begins to show an interest in Charley, and Charley finds himself faced with increasingly difficult choices.

Body and Soul (1947) John Garfield, Lilli Palmer, Hazel Brooks
sources.description: Body and Soul is a 1947 American film noir sports drama directed by Robert Rossen, and features John Garfield, Lilli Palmer, Hazel Brooks, Anne Revere and William Conrad. The film, written by Abraham Polonsky with cinematography by James Wong Howe, is considered by some to be high among the best films about boxing. It is also a cautionary tale about the lure of money and how it can derail even a strong man in his pursuit of success.
